jurisdiction.title: Community Colleges of Colorado - College Composition and Reading 092

1566C2A857494F7BBB30C2FFC89DD6F9.description: Demonstrate knowledge of and ability to engage in the behaviors of persistent and successful college students.

4E13AEA148734F768F010046F4E898FE.description: Identify and utilize academic support resources.

CE0BA57E684F4605A096634E0E6152A0.description: Evaluate their reading and writing processes in order to transfer them to new situations.

C65902468FC64B23BAAC2EEF548837A0.description: Demonstrate knowledge of and ability to reflect on their own reading and writing processes and to apply strategies to cross-curricular reading and writing tasks.

E086E0C6DA174068A47F4CCF3D4E0458.description: Edit for punctuation, grammar, mechanics, and conventions within the context of their writing.

601D85C0165D4739ADB6310F5A193157.description: Revise drafts for clarity, purpose, audience, unity, and support.

39B3BB6B841F45BA8616419706905324.description: Create multiple drafts of complete, multi-paragraph academic essays—moving beyond formulaic five-paragraph essays.

7CA76D268F5D47C892CEFD6859886BC7.description: Choose topics appropriate for an academic audience.

8F542A7B79F3408C8EB3306F814E1295.description: Demonstrate knowledge of and ability to use the writing process—including prewriting, drafting, revising, and editing— to write informatively and persuasively in multiple genres using college-level course materials.

061659C990E842C28FB5F4DCEF9E8F4D.description: Integrate source information, with judicious use of direct quotations, following a standard citation format.

FFA15AACA91E4EB8AFD0F8B60C061BF4.description: Structure and organize information into a coherent format.

F33D8D64F81F4B369C9C72E40AA8E041.description: Use academic tone, diction, and conventions.

8A0DC7033FD24C118BF0029F4E3338EB.description: Identify and communicate main points without bias.

124DC0E123D2452E995E6DFF1458A6D9.description: Demonstrate knowledge of and ability to summarize course materials applying the steps of the reading and writing processes, using college-level resources.

69F7A3055C914487B0D600FCC5FA0F90.description: Analyze readings and course materials to determine 1. Author’s purpose and tone 2. Bias 3. Point of view 4. Author’s credibility 5. Validity 6. Adequacy and relevancy of support.	7. Differences between fact and opinion 8. Patterns of organization

F33FCDD333D4495CA65C4E61D14AB532.description: Analyze college level course materials through post reading activities such as outlining or graphically organizing from the text.

735BE7223A3444B68F0FE5ECB6192E33.description: Annotate texts to identify key points, organize relationships between information, exemplify, explain, infer, summarize, and paraphrase. 1. Use context clues and word parts to define unfamiliar words, phrases, and expressions. 2. Use signal words and phrases to identify organizational patterns. 3. Use a variety of strategies—read out loud, alternate text, re-read, visualize, summarize, represent concepts in graphic form, talk it out, for example— to improve reading compression.

6271A01AEDB84CF894F687082CFFEFC4.description: Engage in pre-reading to organize the reading task, to activate schema, and to determine the meaning of unfamiliar words and concepts. 1. Use heading and sub-headings to determine topics and sub-topics. 2. Create a plan for reading.

66D1D9B638ED4FE5AF158CAB4018B48C.description: Demonstrate knowledge of and ability to read for multiple levels of understanding, to read critically, and to apply the steps of the reading process, including pre-reading, annotating and analysis, using college-level readings and materials.
